json.text: distilled from an object or fluid. It's the most fundamental part of the alchemical arts. There are eighteen types of Essentia, each bearing a particular

, groupings of Essentia types that share similar themes.


The
contains Essentia that represent the six core affinities of magic that most magicians are already familiar with:

. In addition to their uses for alchemy, Essentia of the House of Elements can be burned in an Eldrin Fume Filter to generate small amounts of Eldrin power (though the bottle it's carried in is, unfortunately, destroyed in the process).


The
what something is; if the House of Elements is about nouns, the House of Qualities is about adjectives. There are eight members of the House of Qualities:
contains four mysterious types of Essentia that represent ascending power and the search for the Philosopher's Stone:

are combinations of different Essentia that represent higher-ordered themes or ideas.

An Admixture can be composed of two to five different kinds of Essentia, always includes at least one type of Essentia of both the House of Elements and the House of Qualities, and never includes Essentia of the House of Alchemy. Some Admixtures can even include other Admixtures.

Admixtures can be obtained by distilling objects and fluids, or by combining Essentia through the alchemical process of Fixation.

The term
is used to refer to something that could be either Essentia or an Admixture.
is to break an object or fluid down into the Materia (that is, Essentia and Admixtures) that make it up. Basic Distillation is performed at an

.

Devices capable of Distillation have an

rating that determines the chance that you will successfully distill each dram of Materia that the object or fluid contains. Efficiency is always noted as a percentage, and Efficiency greater than 100% has no additional effect.
is to transform an object to a differently pigmented state. Basic coloration is performed at a
is to form matter from the ambient creative power of the planet itself, seemingly out of nothing at all. Conjuration is performed at the

.

The simplest form of conjuration is familiar to many, even alchemical laymen—the cobblestone produced when water and lava touch. Through practical application of alchemical principles, many other natural materials can also be Conjured.
is a simple device capable of performing
. A lit smoker or blast furnace is the most effective, followed by a lit furnace or a

spell.


Passive heat sources (such as magma blocks, lava, or campfires) can also be used but will cause the device to distill at a slower rate.
The tall, leftmost slot is for fluids and is currently unimplemented.

The three slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia. Items placed within these slots will process one at a time, from the bottom-most slot to the top-most slot.

The nine slots to the right of the processing slot hold distilled Materia, which can only be extracted from the machine if bottles are present in the slot at the top.

The wavy lines below the alchemical Distillation symbol represent the device's current heat. A bright yellow-orange represents heat from a furnace, blast furnace, or smoker, while a dark red represents a passive heat source.
The more complex devices of the alchemist’s art require a

, a ring of ensorcelled silver that focuses creative energy and Materia into a desired outcome.

Magic Circles are made of
, an alchemical alloy of quicksilver, chimerite, and some Admixtures made on the Manaweaving Altar.
While copper is an acceptable material for a simple Alembic, advanced alchemical devices require an advanced material.
combines the magical conductivity of gold with the alchemical inertness of quicksilver. The resultant alloy amplifies the alchemical magic of materia, but is unaffected by physical contact.
uses Materia to create blocks and items. A Circle of Fabrication requires

On the far left side is a panel with fifteen slots used to select what you want the Circle of Fabrication to craft. Typing in the black bar on the top of the panel filters which recipes are shown. Once a recipe is selected, it appears under the alchemical triangle in the center and a second panel appears in the lower right to indicate what Materia are required for each craft.

The alchemical triangle in the center represents the progress on the current craft, and fills as the process gets closer to completion.

To the left of the alchemical triangle are ten slots for input Materia. When a recipe is selected, two slots will be reserved for each type of Materia required by the recipe and no other types of Materia can be inserted.

In the upper right, you can set the desired FE usage of the Circle of Fabrication; as the power usage goes up, the amount of time the Circle of Fabrication requires to perform each crafting operation goes down. Changing the desired power usage will reset the progress on any current crafting operation.

Whenever the Circle of Fabrication creates a block or item, all of the Materia used is consumed and the bottles are returned into the bottle output slot. If there’s not enough space in the bottle output slot, the Circle of Fabrication won’t begin crafting until there’s enough space.
if supplied with at least one

at Tier 5.

On the far right side of the GUI, items that

can be recharged.

A reagent burns for a time based on its tier. After its burn duration concludes, the Circle of Power ejects a waste product into a special slot that can be reprocessed back into the reagent with Constructs. If this slot is full, the waste product is ejected into the world instead.

One reagent is available at Tier 2, and an additional reagent becomes available at Tier 3, Tier 4, and Tier 5.

By default, each additional reagent supplied to the Circle of Power increases its power generation twelvefold. Power is generated based on the

reagent present. For example, supplying the first two reagents will generate more power than supplying only the fourth reagent.

The Circle of Power only generates up to three ticks’ worth of FE.

All waste products can be

back into a usable reagent with some Construct labor; with well-constructed Construct logic no Circle of Power should require more than two of any individual reagent.

One Construct can handle the needs of the first two reagents, but the third and fourth require a dedicated Construct each.

are the most basic energy-generating reagent used in the Circle of Power. Grains of Quicksilver can be made at Tier 2 by having a Construct crush a Quicksilver ingot.

The Grains have a very short burn time and eject a
The Tarnished Quicksilver Lump can be crushed by a Construct back into Grains of Quicksilver.
is a more advanced energy-generating reagent used in the Circle of Power. Focusing Catalysts can be made at Tier 3 by pounding a block of Quicksilver into a
on a Runic Anvil, and Catalyst Cores can be made on the

.

The Catalyst has a moderate burn time and ejects a
A Construct can grind apart a Warped Focusing Catalyst, separating the

.

A Depleted Catalyst Core can be recharged into a Catalyst Core by smelting it in the Runeforge. This operation takes significantly longer than it normally takes to smelt an object.

Once the Catalyst Core is recharged, you can turn it back into a Focusing Catalyst by pounding the Catalyst Casing into it on a Runic Anvil.
is yet another energy-generating reagent used in the Circle of Power. Amplifying Prisms can be made at Tier 4 by shaping a lump of
on a Runic Anvil. Refractive Crystal Glass can be made on the

.

The Prism has a long burn time and ejects
A Construct can grind Malformed Brindle Glass into six piles of

, each bearing a different color impurity.

Each color-tinged grit can have its color impurity removed by crafting it together with the appropriate counterbalancing dye or by processing it with Alchemical Coloration on the Variegator. Variegators set to use the counterbalancing color can do this process for free, albeit slowly, but a Variegator set to un-dye will require Admixture of Color.

Once all six piles of grit have had their color impurities purged, they can be crafted together into a pile of

.

The Refractive Crystal Sand can be smelted in a Runeforge to create Refractive Crystal Glass, which can be re-carved into an Amplifying Prism on the Runic Anvil along with Glass Cutting Tools.
is the final energy-generating reagent used in the Circle of Power. It can be made at Tier 5 by combining six

in a Manaweaving Altar.

Circle Projection Apparati can be made on the Alchemical Nexus.

The Array has a very long burn time and ejects six
A Construct can grind a Ruined Projection Apparatus into five components: A

. Each of these components must be repaired separately.

The Lightwracked Projection Gem can have its inner light quenched by processing it through Black on a Variegator.

The Dissonant Crystal Core can be re-harmonized by resonating it alongside a

on a Manaweaving Altar. The Harmoniscope is not consumed.

The Befouled Projection Casing can be purged of its impurities in a Runeforge.

The Contorted Pennons can be straightened out with several well placed hammer strikes against a

on a Runic Anvil. The Netherite Shaping Plane is not consumed.

Once all five components have been repaired, they can be crafted back into a
, six of which can be combined into a new Auxiliary Circle Array on a Manaweaving Altar.
can be used to transfer Forge Energy (FE) from a

into other devices. You can bind the Power Spike to the Circle by using the Power Spike on the Circle of Power while sneaking.

Power Spikes can insert power into any device with no range limit as long as the Circle of Power it is bound to is in a loaded chunk. Power Spikes can
draw energy from a Circle of Power.

While a determined runesmith (or a construct) can create bottles efficiently on a runic anvil, the process could always be improved.

Superheating glass panes in a Runeforge before working them on the anvil reduces the number of strikes required from four to one.
is an advanced device capable of performing
A quicksilver gear on one corner of the device can be cranked to operate the device—either manually, with a construct set to

the block, or for ten minutes by dusting it with Animus Dust.

Two corners of the device have
ports if you wish to enhance the device using Eldrin power.

The large slot in the center of the device holds the current Admixture being processed. The three slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be any Admixture.

Directly above the processing slot is a slot for bottles. Each time the centrifuge processes an Admixture, its bottle will be inserted into this slot. If there's not enough space for another bottle, the machine will stall until space is made.

The nine slots to the right of the processing slot hold separated Materia, which can only be extracted from the machine if bottles are present in the single slot above the output slots.
is to take component Materia and combine them into a new Admixture. Basic Fixation is performed at a
is to break an Admixture into the Materia (that is, Essentia or other Admixtures) that make it up. Basic Separation is performed at a

.

Devices capable of Separation have an

rating that determines the chance that you will successfully separate each dram of Materia that the Admixture is composed of. Efficiency is always noted as a percentage, and Efficiency greater than 100% has no additional effect.
is an advanced device capable of performing

On the far left side is a panel with fifteen slots used to select what you want the Fusery to craft. Typing in the black bar on the top of the panel filters which recipes are shown. Once a recipe is selected, it appears under the alchemical Fixation symbol in the center and a second panel appears to the lower right to indicate what Materia are required for each craft.

The alchemical Fixation symbol in the center represents the progress on the current craft, and fills as the process gets closer to completion.

To the left of the alchemical Fixation symbol are ten slots for input Materia. When a recipe is selected, two slots will be reserved for each type of Materia required by the recipe and no other types of Materia can be inserted.

Whenever the Fusery creates an Admixture, all of the Materia used is consumed and the bottles are pushed to the bottle output slot above the alchemical Fixation symbol. If there's not enough space in the bottle output slot, excess bottles will be ejected into the world.
is a device capable of performing simple, if imprecise,

.

You must supply one or more pieces of dye in addition to the item to color. After waiting for the item to steep in the Cauldron for awhile, the item will transform into a color

the dye supplied.

You can supply multiple pieces of dye to remove other colors from the pool of potential colors. Each additional dye allows you to color an additional item with the same pool of potential colors. Only one piece of each color of dye can be added to the Coloring Cauldron until all the dye inside has been used up.

Items are inserted into the Coloring Cauldron by throwing them. The coloring process takes about a minute if only a single piece of dye is supplied, but this time is significantly reduced by adding more pieces of dye.
is a device capable of performing

.

The Coloration process is normally very slow, but supplying the Variegator with

speeds up the process significantly. One piece of dye can Color several items.

The Variegator can also be supplied with

to further enhance its speed. Admixture of Color acts as any dye and can be used to un-dye certain items. If the Variegator also has dye of a matching color, the process is further sped up based on how full the dye reservoir is. The dye is not consumed, only the Admixture of Color is.

The alchemical Coloration symbol at the center represents how complete the current process is.

The three slots to the left of that are for input items. Items placed within these slots will process one at a time, from the bottom-most slot to the top-most slot.

The three slots to the right of the alchemical Coloration symbol hold items that have finished being Colored.

The slot below the alchemical Coloration symbol shows the currently selected color.

The sixteen gauges at the top are the dye reservoirs. Clicking one of these reservoirs sets the current color. The exact amount of dye in each reservoir is reported in its tooltip.

The tall gauge to the left is the Admixture of Color reservoir. The exact amount of Admixture of Color stored is reported in its tooltip.

The small, round, checkered button to the upper left of the Admxiture of Color reservoir can be clicked to set the Variegator to un-dye items.
is an advanced device capable of performing

On the far left side is a panel with fifteen slots used to select what you want the Alchemical Nexus to craft. Typing in the black bar on the top of the panel filters which recipes are shown. Once a recipe is selected, it appears under the alchemical Sublimation symbol in the center.

The alchemical Sublimation symbol in the center represents the progress on the current craft. It begins filling once all ingredients and materia are provided, and fills as the process gets closer to completion.

To the left of the alchemical Sublimation symbol are ten slots, the rightmost group of five for materia and the leftmost group for ingredient items. When a recipe is selected, two slots will be reserved for each type of item and materia required by the recipe and no items can be inserted. Materia cannot be directly inserted, only drawn from nearby Jars or Vessels.

In the top right is a single slot that can take a Rune of Marking or a Book of Marks. The Alchemical Nexus will try to draw materia from Jars or Vessels placed at the marked location(s).

Between the mark slot and the output slots is a gauge that displays how many stages the current recipe has. Recipes with multiple stages will pause after crafting and wait for new ingredients and materia.

Directly above the alchemical Sublimation symbol is a slot used by recipes with more than one stage. If you wish to abort a multi stage craft, remove the

item from the slot. Right clicking this item will extract any consumed ingredients. If you right click while bottles are in your inventory, consumed materia will be bottled and also extracted. There is no way to retrieve spent Academic Slurry.

is a device that consumes elemental Essentia and/or Eldrin power (and other reagents) in order to enhance an alchemical device. An elemental actuator supplied with both Essentia and appropriate Eldrin power becomes much more effcient, consuming both resources at a much slower rate.

The Alembic is too simple and crude to make use of Elemental Actuators, but all other devices have at least two ports that an Elemental Actuator can be plugged into. Looking at a port while sneaking will provide you with a list of what Elemental Actuators are compatible with the device.

Slotting multiple copies of an Elemental Actuator into the same device has no effect; only one of the Actuators will have any effect on the target device.

Elemental Actuators that use Earth, Water, Air, and Fire Eldrin power can be crafted at Tier 3, while those that use Arcane and Ender Eldrin power can be crafted at Tier 4.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Earth Essentia and/or Earth Eldrin power. It must also be supplied with sand, some of which is consumed every operation.

When the device the Quake Refinery is modifying finishes an operation, the Grime produced is reduced and stored inside the Refinery's impressively large internal buffer.

A portion of the reduced Grime becomes Rarefied Waste instead of Alchemical Waste. The Quake Refinery doesn't need to be cleaned; waste can be directly extracted instead.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Quake Refinery how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental earth symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.
To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much Grime is currently stored inside the Quake Refinery.

In the center of the interface are three item slots. The top gauge accepts sand, which enter an internal buffer. Sand is consumed every time the linked device completes an operation. Below the sand slot are two slots that will fill with Alchemical Waste and Rarefied Waste from the Quake Refinery's Grime buffer.
To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much Sand is currently stored inside the Quake Refinery's internal buffer.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Water Essentia and/or Water Eldrin power. It must also be supplied with water, some of which is consumed every operation.

The device the Deluge Purifier is modifying benefits from increased Efficiency.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Deluge Purifier how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental water symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.

To the right of this, a wide and tall gauge acts as a tank for water, which is consumed every Eldrin power cycle.

To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much
has accumulated in the device. Whenever the targeted device finishes an operation, the Deluge Purifier generates some Steam. Steam can be used by a

. There is no negative effect to the machine if the Steam gauge is full, and excess Steam vents out harmlessly.

The rightmost area of the interface shows you how much the target device's Efficiency is being increased as well as the current amount of Eldrin power consumed every cycle.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Fire Essentia and/or Fire Eldrin power. It can optionally be given fuel items, which increases the device's effectiveness.

When modifying an alchemical device that uses FE, the device's FE usage is decreased. Devices that don't use FE have their operation time reduced instead.

An Inferno Engine will also constantly operate a Distillery, Centrifuge, or Fusery.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Inferno Engine how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental fire symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.

To the right of this, a slot can be filled with fuel items to enhance the device's effectiveness. The wavy fumes above the slot show how much time is remaining on the current fuel item, much like a vanilla furnace.

To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much
has accumulated in the device. Whenever the targeted device finishes an operation, the Inferno Engine generates some Smoke. Smoke can be used by a

. There is no negative effect to the machine if the Smoke gauge is full, and excess Smoke vents out harmlessly.

The rightmost area of the interface shows you how much FE or operation time reduction the Inferno Engine is supplying as well as the current amount of Eldrin power consumed every cycle.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Air Essentia and/or Air Eldrin Power.

When modifying an alchemical device, a Gale Pressurizer increases the
number of items that can be processed simultaneously

at the cost of increasing the device's operation time (or its power usage, if the device uses FE).

A Gale Pressurizer only has 3 possible power consumption settings. If set to the middle power setting, it must be supplied with either
(a byproduct of the Deluge Purifier) or
(a byproduct of the Inferno Engine) in order to function. If set to the highest power setting, it must be supplied with both.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Gale Pressurizer how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental air symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.

To the right of this, there are two fluid tanks. The left tank holds

.

The rightmost area of the interface shows you what the current batch size multiplier is, how much the linked device's FE or operation time is being increased, as well as the current amount of Steam and Smoke consumed whenever the linked device completes an operation and the amount of Eldrin power consumed every cycle.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Arcane Essentia and/or Arcane Eldrin Power.

When modifying an alchemical device that consumes Academic Slurry, the Occult Matrix
reduces the amount of Slurry consumed

by a large percentage. The device will also draw from the Occult Matrix's substantial reservoir of Academic Slurry if any is present.

When modifying an alchemical device that doesn't consume Academic Slurry, the Occult Matrix will instead
create a small amount of Academic Slurry
whenever the linked device completes an operation.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Occult Matrix how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental arcane symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.

To the right of this, there is a fluid tanks that holds a substantial amount of

.

Urns, tanks, or Crystals of Memories placed in the upper item slot next to the Academic Slurry tank will try to dump their contents into the reservoir, while such items placed in the lower item slot will try to fill themselves from the reservoir instead.

The rightmost area of the interface shows you what the current Academic Slurry reduction or creation rate is as well the amount of Eldrin power consumed each cycle.
As an alchemical device operates, it builds up

. Successful operations produce more Grime than failed ones, and a device loses efficiency and has longer operation time when it has accumulated more than 50% of its Grime capacity.

A device can be manually cleaned with a
or automatically cleaned with a Construct bound to a

task in a Lodestar.

Cleaning a device produces
, a favorite snack of Constructs. Do with that information what you will.

This command will cause a construct to extract materia from an alchemical device and attempt to place it in Materia Vessels within a specified area.

When emptying the alchemical device, the construct will always take materia from the largest stack first.

It requires a

.

The construct is capable of moving two drams of materia per operation by default. If the construct was summoned with

it can move up to four drams per level of affinity instead.

If the construct has a
inside, it can move 32 additional drams of materia per operation.
The materia sorting process can be greatly sped up if the construct has a
in addition to the required Fluid Nozzle, and is made entirely of

.

When all of these requirements are met, the construct can direct the materia to
to its destination instead of needing to physically move the materia from location to location.

This command will cause a construct to extract materia from Jars or Vessels within a specified area and attempt to insert it into a materia-using alchemical device.

Constructs can provide materia to the
. The construct is capable of moving two drams of materia per operation by default. If the construct was summoned with

it can move up to four drams per level of affinity instead.

If the construct has a

inside, it can move 32 additional drams of materia per operation.

Materia provided to an Alchemical Nexus by a construct transfers at a slower rate than the Nexus can pull on its own, and it does not benefit from the increased speed from increasing the experience cost per crafting stage.
The materia sorting process can be greatly sped up if the construct has a
in addition to the required Fluid Nozzle, and is made entirely of

.

When all of these requirements are met, the construct can direct the materia to
to its destination instead of needing to physically move the materia from location to location.

This command will cause the construct to use some internally stored water to clean the Grime off of an alchemical device at the target location.

It requires a
This command will cause a construct to
. Unfortunately, a construct's little noggin isn't good at retaining information; it simply spills out onto the floor as an

.

A construct must be holding appropriate study materials (like a book, a Codex Arcana, a torn journal fragment, or a thesis) in order to Study. The study materials are destroyed in the process. Simple study materials provide smaller experience orbs than rarer or harder to obtain study materials.
This command will cause the construct to seek out
in a defined area, sucking them up with a fluid nozzle and storing them as
This command will cause the construct to seek out and break

in a defined area.

It requires a
. Firing magical sound waves through the mana cannon allows the construct to shatter the crystal clusters at a distance, perfect for reaching those pesky clusters on the ceilings of a geode.
check whether a Materia Vessel's contents are above a given percent
check whether an alchemical device's internal Grime has reached a certain percent

is a small glass container used to store Materia.

You can insert Materia by right clicking it with a Materia bottle, and extract its contents by right clicking with an empty bottle.

Looking at a Materia Jar will show you the name of its contents, its alchemical formula, the current amount stored, and maximum capacity.

With default configs, Materia Jars containing Essentia can store
as much as Materia Jars containing Admixtures.
is an improved version of the
that has been alchemically treated to hold large amounts of Materia. With default configs, it holds

as much materia.


Care should be taken when performing the
—the contents of Materia Jars will not be kept in the upgrading process, so make sure to empty them out first.
An improvement on the simple Alembic, a
is an advanced form of the Alembic, capable of performing

.

Unlike the Alembic, the Distillery has a furnace built in and can supply its own heat if given fuel. The Distillery will burn fuel even if there is no item to process.

The sides of the device have Elemental Actuator ports if you wish to enhance the device using Eldrin power.

Like an Alembic, the Distillery can be lit with a
The tall, leftmost slot is for fluids and is currently unimplemented.

The six slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia. Items placed within these slots will process one at a time, from the bottom-most slot to the top-most slot.The large slot in the center of the device holds the current object being processed. The three slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia.

The eighteen slots to the right of the processing slot hold distilled Materia, which can only be extracted from the machine if bottles are present in the slot at the top.

At the bottom is a single slot that fuel items can be inserted into.
When Grime is cleaned out of an alchemical device, it produces an unpleasant, smelly residue called

.

This foul residue has precious few practical uses. Notably, it reacts well with an Admixture of Memories to create an elixir that allows an enterprising alchemist to learn from failures.

There are few safe ways to dispose of Alchemical Waste, but feeding it to a hungry Construct is known to be safe and effective. It doesn't hurt that Alchemical Waste is a beloved treat for Constructs the worlds over.
A portion of the Grime reduced by a Quake Refinery becomes

instead of Alchemical Waste.

Rarefied Waste doesn't display any of the properties of its sibling material. Instead, it can be processed in any alchemical device capable of Distillation to produce a random Admixture.

Admixtures produced by distilling Rarefied Waste are
weighted towards Admixtures of lower order.
Critical to any well-organized laboratory, a

lists every type of materia stored in nearby Materia Jars or Materia Vessels. Essentia is listed first, and then Admixtures, both in alphabetical order.

Clicking on any of the listed types of materia will cause the Materia Manifest to

from itself to the Jar or Vessel that contains that Materia. This beam persists until you open the Materia Manifest again or until the chunk the Materia Manifest is in unloads.

By default, a Materia Manifest will scan all Jars and Vessels within 8 blocks of itself. If you activate the Maniest while holding a
, the Manifest will begin monitoring Jars and Vessels in that area instead.
Certain alchemical processes require knowledge as a reagent. Rather than being drawn directly from the alchemist's mind, these processes use

.

Academic Slurry can be thought of as "liquid experience". There are several methods of creating Academic Slurry, but the most direct method is by using a
The Experience Exchanger is a wondrous contraption that converts the experiences stored within a
. It must be placed on top of a

(or another fluid-storing container).

Activating the Experience Exchanger while holding a Crystal of Memories inserts the crystal, and activating it with an empty hand removes the crystal.

If the Crystal of Memories is in Take Experience mode, the Experience Exchanger will draw Academic Slurry out of the Brimming Urn and store it within the Crystal of Memories.

If the Crystal of Memories is in Return Experience mode, the Experience Exchanger will draw experience out of the Crystal of Memories and deposit it as Academic Slurry in the Brimming Urn.
is to infuse an object with Materia to enhance it in some way or to impart it with magical properties. Basic Sublimation is performed using the
This ritual is used to perform simple

is necessary to select the recipe you want to perform with the ritual.

This ritual requires two
in specific locations (specifically, the "crook" of the scale). If you attempt to start the ritual with missing or misplaced materia containers, the correct locations will be highlighted.

The curious result of suppressing the cinders of a campfire with Admixture of Cold until only its Light remains.

An
can't be seen, touched, or quenched, but casts light as though it were an invisible lantern.
An alloy that combines the workability of gold with the inertness of Quicksilver,
is the ideal material to construct an alchemical apparatus out of.

takes its name from the shifting hues of chimerite blended into Quicksilver and amplified with Admixture of Color.

Iris Argenti is used to create
and internal components for advanced alchemical devices.
is used to select a recipe for the
A wondrous fuel source, brimming with inner light and free of all impurities. It burns

than coal (a little over half an hour).

An
fueled with Catalytic Carbon burns hotter with purer flame, boosting the actuator's enhancement to operation time or FE usage.

A carved rock from deep in the earth instilled with malice and the rage of a storm cloud.

When thrown, the thunderstone will

to smite your foes.

If for whatever reason the thunderstone cannot call a lightning strike, it won't be consumed and will drop on the ground instead.

Sunlight that has been alchemically rendered into a liquid state. Casts light as bright as a torch.

Living creatures that touch Liquid Light can
for a short time, and they are

.

Undead creatures that touch Liquid Light are
A fire charge that has been alchemically transformed. When used, a

in a small area.

This wonder was developed by alchemists in hot climates where Admixture of Cold is scarce; it uses an obtuse approach that requires none.

A recreation of simple redstone devices made with magical materials.

When a Quicksilver button or pressure plate is activated, it gives off a redstone signal
equal to one plus the activator's Tier
An alchemically modified version of a quicksilver pressure plate that will

steps on it.

A Construct Pressure Plate always outputs a signal strength of 15.

You're probably not supposed to have one of these, but in case you do get your grubby mitts on one, here's what you can do with it.

Right clicking a materia jar or vessel will create a shlorp that adds

. There's no effect on an empty jar/vessel.

You can insert the Orb into any slot of the Circle of Power and it'll act as an infinite reagent that is
never spits out a waste product

.

You can insert the orb into any device that requires bottles to extract materia by hand. It

to extract materia.

You can insert the orb into the materia slot of any elemental actuator. It acts as an

of power, and if inserted into a Deluge Purifier additionally supplies water.

You can insert the orb into an Experience Exchanger or Occult Matrix. It acts as an

A smaller, portable version of a Circle of Power that can be used to
recharge items that hold FE charge

.

A Power Spike can be inserted into the upper right slot, which determines what Circle of Power to draw FE from. The item to be recharged can be inserted into the lower left slot.

While there are no extra benefits for doing so, a Charging Talisman can be worn in a neck or charm curio slot.
Note: Neither Mana and Artifice or MagiChem include any items that hold FE charge. This item is intended to be used alongside other mods.

The Alembic is a servicable device for an alchemical novice, but a serious alchemist needs more sophisticated tools.

The

is the core of every alchemical device more complicated than the Alembic. Constructing these precision alchemical components requires a lot of work and many steps, but the results are more than worth it.

The difficulty of creating Magichemical Mechanisms is
reduced once your laboratory has an
at the center of a pentacle, an

will absorb all chalk runes, attuned spirit crystals, skulls, candles, and sacrificial bowls.

Using the Talisman again will place the pentacle back down in the same state it was picked up in, including placement of sacrificial bowls.

Ideal for the occultist concerned with efficient use of space!
An amethyst drained of all of its natural color in the

. Only a White operation can bleach the crystal, the shard will resist any other color.

Bleached Amethyst Shards are ideal for focusing colored light; they are a core component of replacing a Coloring Cauldron with a

In addition to its gravity-defying and color-transmitting properties, bleached amethyst is an ideal medium for alchemically-distilled light.

These hovering, glowing crystals can be used to light up a workshop with some magical flair.

Up to six crystal candles can occupy the same block.

and two additional Elemental Actuator ports over the Distillery.

Unlike the Alembic and the Distillery, the Grand Distillery requires FE from a

in order to run. The amount of FE required can be controlled; higher FE usage results in faster distillations.

At Tier 5, the Grand Distillery can be upgraded to have 6 Elemental Actuator ports using a

.

The Grand Distillery requires a significant amount of FE even at its minimum settings; a Circle of Power with
The tall, leftmost slot is for fluids and is currently unimplemented.

The six slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia. Items placed within these slots will process one at a time, from the bottom-most slot to the top-most slot.The large slot in the center of the device holds the current object being processed. The three slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia.

The eighteen slots to the right of the processing slot hold distilled Materia, which can only be extracted from the machine if bottles are present in the slot at the top.

On the far right is a gauge that you can use to set the FE consumption of the device (and by extension, its operation time).

can be used to upgrade a
to have 6 ports for Elemental Actuators instead of 4.
The Conjurer makes use of a modified version of the natural process by which cobblestone is created when water and lava touch. It can
create a large variety of items seemingly out of nothing

, provided the correct conjuring catalyst is provided—usually the item itself.

The conjuration process is relatively slow, but costs nothing. If provided with a
determined by the item being conjured, the process is drastically sped up and produces much larger batches at once.

instead.
